alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Bryan (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 12 at 9:30AM CDT until June 12 at 9:45AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM CDT FOR CENTRAL BRYAN AND SOUTH CENTRAL ATOKA COUNTIES... At 929 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Lane to 4 miles southeast of Bennington to 7 miles south of Albany, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Bokchito, Bennington, Utica, Albany, Wade, and Bentley. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
